text: Anyone from HS know anything about this...? <https://securityheaders.com/?q=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.square2marketing.com&followRedirects=on>
Seems like the servers could be hardened a little
Merrill Lynch login page gets a D with that tool and TD Online Banking gets an F!

hey <@U25PYL3Q8> the optional HTTP headers are something that we've considered extensively. There are long-winded reasons for not having them in place by default for HubSpot-hosted sites. For HSTS, you can put in a support ticket to have the max-age extended. For `X-Frame-Options` and (a different) CSP, it's possible to implement those in the HTML of your content if you choose, but its easier to break your website/content previews & editing functions than arguably the value of protections you get (I've done it to myself, proceed cautiously). `X-Content-Type-Options` is implemented, but for your (more sensitive) logged-in session on <http://app.HubSpot.com|app.HubSpot.com>
